questions.text: A previously healthy 14-year-old boy comes to the physician because of a 5-day history of pain at the back of his left ankle. His mother had a myocardial infarction at 54 years. His BMI is 23 kg/m². A photomicrograph from a biopsy of the nodule is shown. Serum studies in this patient are most likely to show increased levels of which of the following?
Which of these is not suggestive of domestic violence in a child?

An old man who was lying on the roadside is brought to the causalty by the police. On detailed history, he reveals that he has had no food for the past few weeks. On examination, he is severely emaciated. What is the likely finding in the gall bladder?
Which of the following is false regarding adipocere formation?

options.label: A
options.text: Facial features are not preserved making identification difficult

options.label: C
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿It is commonly seen in bodies immersed in water

options.label: D
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿It has distinct offensive or sweetish smell

questions.correct_answer: A. Facial features are not preserved making identification difficult
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Facial features are not preserved making identification difficult

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of behavioral problems. His mother says that he has frequent angry outbursts and gets into fights with his classmates. He constantly complains of feeling hungry, even after eating a full meal. Physical examination shows central obesity, undescended testes, almond-shaped eyes, and a thin upper lip. Which of the following genetic changes is most likely associated with this patient’s condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Microdeletion of long arm of chromosome 7

options.label: D
options.text: De novo mutation of MECP2 on X chromosome

questions.text: You notice tearing of the skin at the ends of a laceration on a victim. What is this finding known as?
Increasing which of the following substances in his diet is most likely to help a patient with PDH deficiency generate energy without further elevating lactate levels?
The initial template DNA strand reads as follows: 5' CATTCAATATCGATC 3'. What would be the resulting mRNA sequence after transcription?

A study is performed in which vascular smooth muscle cells are divided into 2 groups: an experimental group treated with the phenylephrine receptor blocker and an untreated control group. Both groups are then exposed to phenylephrine. Compared to the control cells, decreased activity of which of the following enzymes is most likely to be observed in the experimental cells?
All are true about the hexose monophosphate shunt: Has a role in prevention of methHb Source of NADPH Utilizes ribose. Will be affected in thiamine deficiency.

A 28-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to anxiety, weakness, dyspnea, and headaches. He is a graduate student in chemistry and was accidentally exposed to nitrites in his research laboratory. Physical examination is notable for cyanosis that is not improved by administration of supplemental oxygen via facemask. Analysis of a sample of arterial blood drawn from this patient prior to any oxygen supplementation is most likely to reveal normal values for which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: ﻿﻿Bound fraction of oxygen in the arterial blood

options.label: D
options.text: ﻿﻿Partial pressure of oxygen in the arterial blood

questions.correct_answer: D. ﻿﻿Partial pressure of oxygen in the arterial blood

questions.text: G5L4 woman has 4 daughters. She comes for USG examination and requests for sex determination of her fetus. What will you do?

options.label: A
options.text: Do USG check for congenital abnormality, gestational age and sex. But don't tell the sex to mother

options.label: B
options.text: Do USG check for congenital abnormality, gestational age and sex and reveal sex to mother

options.label: C
options.text: Do USG-check for congenital abnormality, and gestational age. Neither check for sex or reveal to mother

questions.correct_answer: C. Do USG-check for congenital abnormality, and gestational age. Neither check for sex or reveal to mother
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Do USG-check for congenital abnormality, and gestational age. Neither check for sex or reveal to mother

questions.text: Identify the correct statement with regards to the changes around an entry wound: Grease collar - due to the deposition of the lubricant of the bullet in the tissues Burn injuries - occur due to flame released during the firing Blackening – due to deposit of smoke Tattooing -Due to unburned grains of gunpowder
When a person dies in a car accident, according to the "DELHI ANATOMY ACT" the body is deemed abandoned after how many hours?

A 15-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department by his parents because of crushing chest pain, nausea, and vomiting for the past 2 hours. The pain is constant and radiates to his left shoulder. Over the past year, he has been admitted to the hospital twice for deep vein thrombosis. The patient is at the 99th percentile for height and the 45th percentile for weight. Electrocardiography shows ST-segment elevation in leads V1 and V2. His serum troponin I concentration is 2.0 ng/mL. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

A 78-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to tenderness and easy bleeding of the gums when she brushes her teeth. Her skin findings are shown in the image. Further questioning reveals that the patient lives alone and that her diet consists primarily of tea and toast. Her symptoms are most likely caused by hypoactivity of an enzyme found in which of the following compartments?

A 14-month-old boy is evaluated for failure to thrive and developmental delay. The toddler has not started babbling or forming words. He is at the 10th percentile for height and 5th percentile for weight. Laboratory results are as follows: HB - 8.9 MCV - 112 Reticulocytes - 1% Ammonia - 42 ug/dl (Normal: 40-80 ug/dl) Urine specimens contain large amounts of orotic acid crystals. Supplementation with which of the following substances would most likely benefit this patient?

A 62-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department after lying on the floor in her home for the past 2 days. The patient says she fell and injured her right hip and was unable to get up to call for help. She did not eat or drink anything during that time. On examination, the patient appears dehydrated and has right hip tenderness. Laboratory studies show serum glucose of 72 mg/dL and positive urine ketones. Increased activity of which of the following enzymes is most likely contributing to both the serum and urine laboratory findings?

A 8-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to vomiting and lethargy. He hasn’t eaten anything for 24 hours. On examination, the patient appears listless. Mild hepatomegaly is noted. Laboratory results are as follows: Glucose- 22 mg/dl Acetoacetate- Undetected ALT- 47 IU AST- 50 IU Patient began seizing in the emergency. The likely deficient enzyme is ?

Succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) is an enzyme complex located within the inner mitochondrial membrane that catalyses the oxidation of succinate to fumarate. An experiment is conducted to determine if malate alters the rate of SDH activity. Reaction velocity is measured with and without a fixed quantity of malate as succinate concentration is gradually increased. Which of the following is the most accurate statement about malate in this experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: It alters the maximal velocity of the reaction

options.label: B
options.text: It binds the enzyme at a different site than succinate

options.label: C
options.text: It decreases affinity of the enzyme for succinate

options.label: D
options.text: It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It is a competitive inhibitor of the enzyme

questions.text: A 26-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-day history of fatigue, back pain, and dark urine. One week ago, he developed a headache and was treated with aspirin. He does not smoke or use illicit drugs. Physical examination shows conjunctival pallor. A peripheral blood smear shows erythrocytes with inclusions of denatured hemoglobin. Which of the following enzymes is essential for the production of nucleotides in this patient?
Which of the following glycosaminoglycan plays an important role in cellular migration?
Pick the most common cause of parasuicide.

Three hours after undergoing a total right hip replacement, a 67-year-old woman has tingling around the lips and numbness in her fingertips. Her surgery was complicated by unintentional laceration of the right femoral artery that resulted in profuse bleeding. Examination shows an adducted thumb, extended fingers, and flexed metacarpophalangeal joints and wrists. Tapping on the cheeks leads to contraction of the facial muscles. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
The principal enzymes controlling glycogen metabolism- glycogen phosphorylase and glycogen synthase. Which of the following statements is inaccurate?

options.label: B
options.text: Phosphorylation of glycogen phosphorylase increases its activity.

options.label: C
options.text: Phosphorylation of glycogen synthase increases its activity.

options.label: D
options.text: Phosphorylation is increased in response to cyclic AMP (CAMP).

questions.correct_answer: C. Phosphorylation of glycogen synthase increases its activity.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Phosphorylation of glycogen synthase increases its activity.

questions.text: Match the following:
Match the following in relation to fingerprint changes:

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the OPD by his parents. After he urinated in the toilet last night, his parents forgot to flush the toilet and noticed that the boy's urine turned black overnight. Urinalysis results are as follows: Color: black Specific gravity: 1.022 Protein: none Blood: negative Glucose: negative Ketones: negative Leukocyte esterase: negative Which of the following conversion pathways is most likely deficient in this patient?
Choose the incorrect statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Most characteristic feature of aconite poisoning is Perioral paraesthesias

options.label: B
options.text: Acute nicotinic poisoning causes ventricular arrhythmias

options.label: C
options.text: Post mortem findings of cyanide poisoning shows B/L symmetric necrosis of lenticular nucleus

options.label: D
options.text: Fatal dose of Aconite poisoning is 10-20 grams of aconite root.

questions.correct_answer: D. Fatal dose of Aconite poisoning is 10-20 grams of aconite root.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Fatal dose of Aconite poisoning is 10-20 grams of aconite root.

questions.text: A 32-year-old previously healthy man comes to the emergency department due to a 3-hour history of chest pain, diaphoresis, and dyspnea. He does not smoke, exercises regularly, and eats a balanced diet. His father died at age 56 from a myocardial infarction. His blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg and pulse is 110/min and regular. ECG shows ST elevation in the anterolateral leads. Coronary angiogram reveals proximal left anterior descending artery stenosis and thrombosis, which is treated with angioplasty and stent placement. Laboratory results are as follows: Total cholesterol: 160 mg/dL Low-density lipoprotein: 90 mg/dL Glucose, serum: 98 mg/dL Homocysteine, plasma: 21.5 µmol/L (normal: 4-14 µmol/L) Further testing reveals a homozygous mutation in the methylene tetrahydrofolate reductase gene that leads to decreased enzymatic activity. Due to this defect, the patient most likely has impairment converting homocysteine to which of the following?
Industrial workers most frequently develop inorganic lead poisoning through:
A patient is brought with symptoms of diarrhea, hair loss, and poor wound healing. Which Mineral deficiency is responsible for these symptoms?

A 25-year-old man who works in the dye industry arrives at the OPD with throat pain, vomiting, dark red feces, and conjunctivitis. Which of the following compounds is most likely responsible for this:

A 28-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to confusion. His roommate says that he has been binge drinking for the last 5 days and probably has had very little to eat. Fingerstick glucose is 35 mg/dL and urine is strongly positive for ketones. Suppression of which of the following is the primary cause of this patient's hypoglycemia?

A 35-year-old patient arrives at the hospital emergency department presenting with gastrointestinal distress. The patient complains of severe abdominal pain, frequent vomiting, and watery diarrhea. During the physical examination, the medical team observes that the patient's stools emit an unusual faint glow. The patient appears disoriented and fatigued. The medical history reveals that the patient attended a local festival the previous day and consumed various food items there. The following exposures might be contributing to which substance toxication?
The following heart sound marked (purple arrow) in the picture will be heard because of:
Methyl-isocyanate, the gas responsible for the Bhopal gas tragedy, killed by:
Which of the following enzymes is not a component of fatty acid synthase complex?

A 27-year-old man presents with four days of progressive, bilateral, lower extremity weakness and dysesthesia. The patient denies any history of trauma, but states that he stayed home from work last week because of fever accompanied by diarrhea. Neurologic examination demonstrates the absence of reflexes in the lower extremities with no cranial nerve deficits. What is the best therapy for this patient’s condition?

A 21-year-old man enrolled in the study is found to excrete large amounts of fructose in his urine despite maintaining a moderate fructose intake. Further evaluation shows a hereditary defect in fructose metabolism, but he is asymptomatic and has no other medical problems. This patient most likely remains able to metabolize fructose due to the compensatory activity of which of the following enzymes?
Identify the enzyme not involved in cholesterol biosynthesis.
Which of the following statements regarding LDL receptors is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Present only in the extra-hepatic tissues

options.label: B
options.text: Clathrin-coated pits contain the receptor on cell membrane

options.label: C
options.text: It is taken into the cells by endocytosis

options.label: D
options.text: Increased cellular cholesterol down- regulates the synthesis of LDL receptors

questions.correct_answer: A. Present only in the extra-hepatic tissues
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Present only in the extra-hepatic tissues

questions.text: Match the following glycoproteins with their function:

2-month-old previously healthy baby was brought to the casualty when the parents found that the baby was not breathing while asleep. Following resuscitative measures, the baby was still apnoeic, pulseless, and asystolic. You suspected sudden infant death syndrome in this child. Which of the following is not a risk factor of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Sharing a bed with a family member

options.label: C
options.text: ﻿﻿﻿Sleeping in prone position or on the side

questions.text: An investigator is studying the genotypes of fire-flies using full exome sequencing. They are found to have a point mutation in the gene encoding wing bud formation during embryogenesis. The point mutation in the gene causes the mRNA transcript to have a "UUG" segment instead of an "AUG" segment. Which of the following processes is most likely affected by this mutation?

options.label: D
options.text: Dissociation of mRNA from ribosome complex

questions.correct_answer: C. Binding of met-tRNA to 60S complex
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Binding of met-tRNA to 60S complex

questions.text: Which of the following pairs of drugs and its indications is matched incorrectly?

options.label: B
options.text: Octreotide – Treatment of diarrhea associated with vasoactive intestinal peptide tumors.

questions.correct_answer: A. Bromocriptine – Treatment of precocious puberty
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Bromocriptine – Treatment of precocious puberty

questions.text: You are a medical resident working in a busy hospital when a 25-year-old female patient is admitted with complaints of chronic fatigue, easy bruising, and hepatosplenomegaly. A bone marrow examination reveals cells with a characteristic appearance as shown in an image. In this clinical scenario, which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for her condition?

A 55-year-old man undergoes an elective surgery under general anesthesia. Two hours into the surgery, his left ventricular pressure-volume loop has changed from the solid line to the dashed line, as shown in the image below. Which of the following is most likely responsible for this patient's hemodynamic change?

Cells that are exposed to longer ischemic periods are found to have reduced numbers of ribosomes attached to the endoplasmic reticulum. This structural change is most likely to impair which of the following cellular functions?
questions.correct_answer: B. Synthesis of cell membrane proteins
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Synthesis of cell membrane proteins

Which part of protein is found in the transmembrane portion of membranous receptors?

A 30-year-old woman delivers her first child at 39 weeks' gestation. On examination, the newborn's skin and hair have a milky white color, and his eyes are light blue with a slight reddish hue. A skin biopsy shows a normal number of epidermal and follicular melanocytes. A defect in which of the following enzymes is the most likely cause of this patient’s condition?
Which of the following is most beneficial in the prevention of coronary artery diseases?

A researcher introduces a human gene into a model organism to study its expression pattern. Using Northern blot analysis, he observes that in the brain tissue sample, there are four distinct bands. However, in the heart, kidney, and liver samples, he sees only a single band. Which of the following explanations could account for these findings?

options.label: B
options.text: The brain has four different genes encoding this protein

Activity of which of the following enzymes is most likely directly impaired in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The mRNA for Transferrin receptor is stabilised by binding of IRP to 3’ stem-loop structures known as IRE.

options.label: B
options.text: The mRNA for the Transferrin receptor is not bound by IRP and is rapidly degraded.

options.text: The mRNA for apoferritin is not bound by IRP at 5’ stem loop IRE and is rapidly degraded.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: B. The mRNA for the Transferrin receptor is not bound by IRP and is rapidly degraded.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The mRNA for the Transferrin receptor is not bound by IRP and is rapidly degraded.

His height and weight are both below the 10th percentile. He is pale and has blue eyes. He cannot pull himself up from a seated position to stand and does not crawl. Immunohistochemical analysis indicates that the malignant cells have decreased integrin expression. These cells are most likely to exhibit poor adhesion to which of the following components of the extracellular matrix?

questions.correct_answer: A. Enzyme acting on two substrates

A 5-day-old female newborn is brought to the physician because of lethargy, vomiting, poor feeding, and diarrhea for 4 days. She was born at 39 weeks' gestation. Vital signs are within normal limits. Bilateral cataracts and icterus are present. Examination shows jaundice of the skin, and the liver is palpated 5-cm below the right costal margin. Which of the following metabolites is most likely to be increased in this patient?
Glycogen phosphorylase requires which of the following for its activation?
Identify the common enzyme between glycogenolysis and glycogenesis

A 12-year-old girl is evaluated for blurry vision. She has no history of head or eye trauma or exposure to ionizing radiation. Motor and cognitive milestones have been achieved at the appropriate age. She has a good appetite and does not follow any specific diet. Urine is positive for reducing substances. Deficient activity of which of the following enzymes is the most likely cause of this patient's eye condition?
Which of the following is used to evaluate hymen rupture in rape victims and identify whether it is recent or not?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the office due to gait instability and pruritic skin rash for the past several weeks. His mother reports that he has also been irritable and had loose stools during this time. The patient's childhood development has been unremarkable except for several episodes of similar skin rash that resolved spontaneously. Examination shows scaly, erythematous skin lesions in sun-exposed areas and cerebellar ataxia. Laboratory evaluation shows increased levels of neutral amino acids in the urine. This patient's symptoms would most likely respond to which of the following supplements?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding of carbon monoxide to myoglobin

options.label: B
options.text: Binding of carbon monoxide to hemoglobin

options.label: D
options.text: Conversion of hemoglobin from T state to R state

questions.correct_answer: A. Binding of carbon monoxide to myoglobin
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Binding of carbon monoxide to myoglobin

questions.text: A 5-month-old full-term boy is brought to the emergency department with lethargy and vomiting. The patient was breastfed exclusively until 2 days ago when homemade pureed food was added to his diet. He has had no fever or diarrhea. Serum glucose is 30 mg/dL. Diagnostic testing confirms aldolase B deficiency. Which of the following should be removed from this patient’s diet?

The patient has yellowish skin nodules over the palmar creases that have been increasing in size and number over the past several years. He also has small clusters of yellow papules on his elbows, knees, and buttocks. Immunoblot analysis suggests a lack of ApoE3 and ApoE4 in his circulating lipoproteins. Which of the following is most likely impaired in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Chylomicron remnant uptake by liver cells

questions.correct_answer: B. Chylomicron remnant uptake by liver cells

questions.text: A 10-year-old male child came to the casualty with difficulty in walking and pain in the perianal region. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, following appearance is seen under the microscope. What is the test done?

Following subsequent rounds of centrifugation, the remaining supernatant contains only cytosol and cytosolic proteins. Activity of which of the following enzymes will most likely be detectable in the supernatant of healthy liver cells?

A 3-year-old boy is being evaluated at the office for failure to thrive and developmental delay. Physical examination shows corneal clouding, hepatosplenomegaly, and restricted joint mobility. Further evaluation shows deficient phosphorylation of mannose residues on certain glycoproteins in the Golgi apparatus. In unaffected patients, these proteins are normally transported to which of the following cellular locations?
Which acid does not cause coagulation necrosis when it comes into contact with it?

A 34-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to bloody emesis. She had 2 episodes of vomiting bright red blood and feels lightheaded and dizzy. The patient was recently diagnosed with factitious disorder after being hospitalized multiple times for a myriad of symptoms and undergoing several invasive procedures. Physical examination shows scattered ecchymoses. Rectal examination shows maroon-colored, guaiac-positive stool. After much questioning, she admits to having ingested rat poison several days ago. Immediate treatment of this patient should include which of the following?
Match the following:

Which of the following is the best method to determine if this gene is being transcribed in cultures of the isolated cells?

Which of the following is the best method to study molecular structure?

A 32-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of blisters and brownish discoloration of urine. His symptoms appeared after he returned from a 4-day trip with his friends in Goa. He has had similar episodes of blistering twice in the past 3 years. Each episode resolved spontaneously after a few weeks. Examination shows vesicles and bullae on the face and the dorsal surfaces of his hands and forearms. His condition is most likely caused by a defect in which of the following enzymes?
As people get older, there is cognitive impairment because of elevated levels of:

A 16-year-old patient happens to have pellagra-like eruptions on skin in spring season from the last 5 years with normal HIAA and high aminoaciduria. Indole levels in urine are normal. What is the probable diagnosis? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Hartnup disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pellagra or pellagra like symptoms can result from ( Differential Diagnosis ):
  • ➤ Differential Diagnosis
  • ➤ Niacin (B3) deficiency due to a diet high in maize, which is low in tryptophan. Vitamin B6 deficiency, since the enzyme kynureninase, which catalyzes a step in niacin synthesis from tryptophan, requires B6 as a cofactor. B6 deficiency also leads to increased synthesis of xanthurenic acid Carcinoid syndrome: can be differentiated with elevated HIAA level with pellagra like symptoms. Hartnup disease can present with pellagra-like symptoms due to defective absorption of tryptophan and other neutral amino acids, leading to high aminoaciduria and niacin deficiency.
  • ➤ Niacin (B3) deficiency due to a diet high in maize, which is low in tryptophan.
  • ➤ Vitamin B6 deficiency, since the enzyme kynureninase, which catalyzes a step in niacin synthesis from tryptophan, requires B6 as a cofactor. B6 deficiency also leads to increased synthesis of xanthurenic acid
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome: can be differentiated with elevated HIAA level with pellagra like symptoms.
  • ➤ Hartnup disease can present with pellagra-like symptoms due to defective absorption of tryptophan and other neutral amino acids, leading to high aminoaciduria and niacin deficiency.

questions.text: Which of the following can be mediated by CRISPR CAS 9 technology? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) DNA editing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CRISPR-Cas9 technology is primarily used for precise DNA editing, enabling targeted modifications to the genetic code

questions.text: Which of the following substances is used for sample collection in a tube for blood alcohol concentration measurement? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Sodium fluoride + Potassium dichromate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sodium fluoride and potassium dichromate are the substances used in the tube for blood alcohol concentration measurement. Potassium dichromate reacts with ethanol in the blood sample, facilitating the detection and quantification of alcohol concentration
  • ➤ Sodium fluoride and potassium dichromate are the substances used in the tube for blood alcohol concentration measurement.

questions.text: Researchers isolate small circular DNA molecules from pancreatic cells that resemble a bacterial chromosome. Further analysis shows that these molecules code for proteins, transfer RNA, and ribosomal RNA. From which of the following cellular structures did these DNA molecules most likely originate?
Gastric lavage is contraindicated in which of the following? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Strychnine poisoning

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gastric lavage is contraindicated in cases of strychnine poisoning due to the high risk of inducing further convulsions and seizures, which can exacerbate the patient's condition.

questions.text: Which drug would be most effective in preventing withdrawal symptoms in a patient with a history of alcohol consumption who was admitted to the hospital after a road traffic accident? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lorazepam

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Benzodiazepines, such as lorazepam, are the drugs of choice to prevent and manage alcohol withdrawal symptoms.

questions.text: Methotrexate is a chemotherapeutic agent used in the treatment of breast cancer. It works by inhibiting the synthesis of which nucleotide? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) TMP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methotrexate inhibits dihydrofolate reductase, leading to a reduction in thymine monophosphate (TMP) synthesis, which is critical for DNA synthesis. This makes it effective in the treatment of cancers, including breast cancer

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient with a history of depression was initially being treated with sertraline, but his symptoms were not adequately controlled. His medication regimen was changed to include an MAO inhibitor and amitriptyline. Shortly after the change in medication, the patient developed agitation, seizures, hyperreflexia, and tremors. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cyproheptadine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Serotonin syndrome can occur when serotonergic drugs are combined, such as SSRIs, MAO inhibitors, and TCAs. The treatment of choice for serotonin syndrome is Cyproheptadine, a serotonin receptor antagonist.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man is brought to the emergency department one hour after developing shortness of breath and “squeezing” chest pain. He has asthma, hypertension, and erectile dysfunction. Current medications include salmeterol, amlodipine, lisinopril, and vardenafil. His pulse is 110/min and blood pressure is 122/70 mm Hg. Physical examination shows diaphoresis. An ECG shows sinus tachycardia. Sublingual nitroglycerin is administered. Five minutes later, his pulse is 137/min and his blood pressure is 78/40 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism of this patient’s hypotension?
In a case of drowning, the following organism was isolated from the internal organs. What is true regarding this organism? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: Outer wall contains silica and chlorophyll

questions.correct_answer: D. Outer wall contains silica and chlorophyll
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Outer wall contains silica and chlorophyll

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Diatoms are unicellular algae with a silica-containing outer wall, making them resistant to acid and present in various organs in drowning cases.

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl was washing her doll with shampoo containing rotenone. Her mother noticed her in an unconscious state. Which is inhibited by the above chemical? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rotenone specifically inhibits Complex I also known as NADH CoQ oxidoreductase (NADH dehydrogenase) in the electron transport chain, blocking electron flow and ATP production.

questions.text: Which of the following requires the most energy to assimilate?
A person with suspected marijuana consumption is brought by the police for urine drug testing. He claims single use of marijuana at a party. Up to how many days can the drug be detected in his urine?
In a case of RTA (Road Traffic Accident), a person has died. Who can order an autopsy? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Police Officer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Police Officer, specifically the Investigating Officer, has the authority to order an autopsy in cases of unexplained or suspicious deaths, such as those resulting from a road traffic accident.

questions.text: A patient consumed a toxic substance and presented with tachycardia, tachypnea, hypertension, and hypocalcemia. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ethylene Glycol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethylene glycol poisoning is characterized by hypocalcemia due to the formation of calcium oxalate crystals and presents with symptoms such as tachycardia, tachypnea, and hypertension.

questions.text: A pregnant woman undergoes USG examination. She is found to have twins, but one-month age gap in twins on USG scan. What is this phenomenon called? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Superfetation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Superfetation is characterized by the occurrence of two separate pregnancies in different menstrual cycles, leading to twins of different gestational ages.

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman with a history of depression is brought to the emergency department after attempting suicide. Her parents report that she consumed 2 bottles of insecticide after having an argument with her boyfriend approximately 2 hours prior to presentation. The patient’s symptoms include nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and copious watery diarrhea. Her breath has a faint garlic odor, and she has numerous healing linear scars on her forearms. Which of the following medications should be administered immediately?
A 14-year-old girl, a victim of rape, presents at 22 weeks for abortion. What advice will you give her? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: MTP cannot be done as she has crossed 20 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: MTP can be done till 24 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: MTP can be done only if the mother's life is at risk

options.label: D
options.text: MTP can only be done if there is a substantial fetal anomaly

questions.correct_answer: B. MTP can be done till 24 weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B)  MTP can be done till 24 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In India, under the MTP Act of 2021:
  • ➤ In India, under the MTP Act of 2021:

questions.text: An investigator is studying the structure of the amino-terminal of the Huntingtin protein using x-ray crystallography. The terminal region is determined to have an α-helix conformation. Which of the following forces is most likely responsible for maintaining this conformation?
A patient came to the emergency room with severe pain in the abdomen. Serum triglyceride level was 1500 mg/dL. Identify the defect? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Apo CII

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type I Hyperlipoproteinemia, presenting with high triglycerides and abdominal pain, is often due to a defect in lipoprotein lipase or its activator, Apo CII.

questions.text: A dead body shows the following finding as in the image. What is the case? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Smothering is characterized by facial injuries resulting from forceful application that obstructs breathing, distinguishing it from neck compression injuries seen in hanging or garrotting.

questions.text: A man wears female heels and a female dress to get sexual arousal. He is not interested in males. What is the diagnosis ? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Transvestic Fetishism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transvestic Fetishism is characterized by cross-dressing for sexual arousal without any associated desire to change one’s gender or sexual orientation.

questions.text: A doctor used the same needle used in a patient with HIV to inject in another patient. The latter patient on testing found to be infected with HIV. The doctor is punishable for this negligence according to which BNS (Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita)?
Identify the incorrect pair of BNS:

options.label: A
options.text: 313 – Criminal abortion without the consent of mother

questions.correct_answer: A. 313 – Criminal abortion without the consent of mother
questions.explanation: Ans. A) 313 – Criminal abortion without the consent of mother

questions.text: Identify the type of physical restraint given in the picture below:
Which metabolic process is inhibited by fluoride produced from Fluoroacetate?
Match the following –

A young patient arrives with hypoglycemia and hepatomegaly. Even after epinephrine injection, blood sugar levels do not rise. The defective enzyme resides in which of the following marked locations in the cell?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the OPD due to abnormal motor development. The boy developed normally during the first year of life. However, for the past 2 years, he has had progressive bilateral leg stiffness and abnormal involuntary movements. Comprehensive laboratory testing reveals significantly elevated arginine levels in plasma and cerebrospinal fluid. The deficient enzyme in this patient is normally involved in the production of which of the following?
A forensic expert is examining the pelvic bone and lower vertebrae of an unknown individual, to determine the sex. Which of the following is regarded as the best source of information for the same?
Which of the following is a Heme breakdown product?

A 36-year-old man with depressed mental status is brought to the emergency department by police. Due to fear of arrest, he swallowed a handful of pills as the officers approached him. On examination, the patient responds to painful stimuli but is somnolent. Pupils are <2 mm. Respirations are 6/min. Lungs are clear to auscultation. Which of the following additional findings are most likely present in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Temperature ↓, Blood pressure ↓, Tidal volume ↓
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Temperature ↓, Blood pressure ↓, Tidal volume ↓

questions.text: When pKa = pH

options.label: A
options.text: Conc. Of drug is 50% ionic and 50% non ionic

options.label: B
options.text: Absorption of drug is 50% in ionic form and 50% non ionic

options.label: C
options.text: Conc. of drug is 75% ionic and 25% non ionic

options.label: D
options.text: Conc. of drug is 25% ionic and 75% non ionic

questions.correct_answer: A. Conc. Of drug is 50% ionic and 50% non ionic
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Conc. Of drug is 50% ionic and 50% non ionic

questions.text: An autopsy is being performed on a 5-year-old boy who recently died from a myocardial infarction. The child had a history of intellectual disability. Autopsy shows a prominent forehead and broad nose. There is a diffuse haze over the corneas bilaterally. The heart, liver, and spleen are enlarged. Sampling of the coronary arteries is most likely to reveal intimal accumulation of which of the following substances?
What is the cause of death in victims of smoke inhalation?
What is the effect of thyroxine hormone on electron Transport chain?

options.label: A
options.text: Stimulation of ETC to generate heat and energy

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of ETC by inhibiting Complex 1

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibition of ATP formation by inhibiting phosphorylation of ADP

questions.correct_answer: C. Inhibition of ATP formation by inhibiting phosphorylation of ADP
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Inhibition of ATP formation by inhibiting phosphorylation of ADP

questions.text: Which technique doesn’t cause protein precipitation?

options.label: D
options.text: Change in pH to other than Isoelectric pH.

questions.correct_answer: D. Change in pH to other than Isoelectric pH.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Change in pH to other than Isoelectric pH.

questions.text: The following ossification centres are present before birth except

A 6-day-old boy is diagnosed with hyperphenylalaninemia by newborn screening. He is placed on a special phenylalanine-restricted diet with tyrosine supplementation. The parents are extensively counseled on the patient's condition and informed of the necessary dietary restrictions. They are also instructed to return to the clinic for regular follow-up visits. Careful examination, however, shows some neurologic abnormalities, including axial hypotonia. Further work-up is notable for elevated prolactin. Which of the following enzymes is most likely deficient in this patient?
Which of the following enzymes use selenocysteine? Glutathione peroxidase Glutathione synthase Deiodinase Thioredoxin reductase
If a dead body is found with bluish green frothy discharge at the angle of mouth and nostrils, then the correct diagnosis is:

A 40-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by ambulance due to nausea, dizziness, and confusion. Her boyfriend arrives with her and says that he found her lying on the bed next to an empty bottle of aspirin tablets. Which of the following sets of laboratory results is most likely to be found in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: pH 7.26, PaCO2 60 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 26 mEq/L

options.label: B
options.text: pH 7.37, PaCO2 18 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 10 mEq/L

options.label: C
options.text: pH 7.42, PaCO2 40 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 25 mEq/L

options.label: D
options.text: pH 7.47, PaCO2 48 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 34 mEq/L

questions.correct_answer: B. pH 7.37, PaCO2 18 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 10 mEq/L
questions.explanation: Ans. B) pH 7.37, PaCO2 18 mm Hg, Plasma HCO3- 10 mEq/L

questions.text: Match the following:

A 22-year-old woman comes to the OPD for a preemployment medical evaluation. The patient has no known medical problems but reports that her skin bruises and scars easily. She says that most of her family members have a very "flexible" body. Physical examination findings are shown in the exhibit. This patient most likely has an inherited defect in which of the following proteins?

Identify the correct statements Potassium levels in vitreous humor fall linearly after death and are a useful measure of time of death. Suspended animation can be seen after electrocution. The 'chicken fat' appearance is typical of a postmortem thrombus. TM, lung and colon are susceptible in secondary blast injury.
Match the following:

After eating some unidentified deadly seeds, a farmer experienced discomfort and vomiting. His lower limbs soon became paralysed, and it eventually progressed to the muscles controlling his breathing, leading to his death two days later. Determine the most likely cause:
The following parameter in ALL indicate a poor prognosis: Age >10 years Leukocyte count <50,000/mm 3 Hyperdiploidy Trisomy of chromosomes 4, 10, and 17 t(9;22) L2

A 65-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to severe abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. Medical history is significant for hypertension, myocardial infarction, and heart failure with reduced ejection fraction. Laboratory results are as follows: Sodium: 136 mEq/L Chloride: 96 mEq/L Bicarbonate: 15 mEq/L pH: 7.30 PaCO2: 32 mm Hg Lactic acid: 6.2 mmol/L CT angiography of the abdomen reveals an occlusion within the proximal superior mesenteric artery. Decreased activity of which of the following enzymes best explains this patient's acid-base disorder?

According to POCSO , Aggravated sexual assault includes – 1.Using deadly weapons 2.Gang sexual assault 3.Causing Grievous hurt 4.In the wake of communal violence 5.Pornography 6.Committed by a police officer
Choose the commonly abused substance which causes physical dependence.

A 45-year-old man comes to the emergency department with severe shortness of breath. The patient has a history of hypertension and medication nonadherence. Blood pressure is 260/144 mm Hg and pulse is 100/min. Chest examination demonstrates bibasilar crackles. Serum creatinine is 1.6 mg/dL. Intravenous furosemide and continuous nitroprusside infusion are started, along with noninvasive positive pressure ventilation, and he experiences improvement in his symptoms. The next morning, the patient is confused and lethargic, and he suffers a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. The skin appears flushed, and serum lactic acid level is elevated. The nitroprusside infusion rate is found to be higher than recommended. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely responsible for the drug toxicity seen in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Impaired conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA

options.label: C
options.text: Increased reduction of hepatic NAD+ to NADH

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibition of electron transfer to oxygen

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibition of electron transfer to oxygen
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Inhibition of electron transfer to oxygen

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding carbamate poisoning is true when compared to organophosphorus poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with faster aging of the cholinesterase enzyme

options.label: B
options.text: It can also lead to the intermediate syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Severe CNS toxicity can be seen

options.label: D
options.text: Pralidoxime is the mainstay in management

questions.correct_answer: B. It can also lead to the intermediate syndrome
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It can also lead to the intermediate syndrome

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl is brought to the clinic due to several months of fatigue and difficulty walking. She ambulates normally at first but rapidly becomes weak and tired. Examination shows mildly decreased power in all extremities but no ataxia. Cardiac auscultation reveals a 1/6 systolic murmur and an S3 gallop. Laboratory results are as follows: Serum chemistry Glucose: 37 mg/dL Creatine kinase: 304 U/L Urinalysis Protein: none Glucose: negative Ketones: negative Leukocyte esterase: negative Nitrites: negative Muscle biopsy shows a very low carnitine content. This patient most likely has deficient synthesis of which of the following substances?
A child was born after 8 months of the father’s death. Grandparents filed a case that the baby might not be their son’s, but DNA came positive. What is such a child called? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Posthumous child

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A posthumous child is one born after the death of a parent, as seen in this scenario where the child was born 8 months after the father's death.

questions.text: Who received Nobel prize in Medicine/Physiology for their work on ‘mRNA and its role in post transcriptional regulation’?
questions.correct_answer: A. Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun

questions.text: Police brought a person from the railway track with features of dry mouth, dilated pupil, dry skin, slurring of speech, and delirium. What could be the possible diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Dhatura

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Dhatura poisoning exhibits an anticholinergic toxidrome characterized by dry mouth, dry skin, dilated pupils, and altered mental status, distinguishing it from other toxidromes.

questions.text: If a woman is undergoing MTP after 24 weeks of gestation due to congenital anomaly in the fetus , whose presence is not required for authorization? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lawyer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In MTP after 24 weeks for congenital anomalies, the medical board's authorization is required and comprises a gynecologist, pediatrician, and sonologist. A lawyer’s presence is not required for this authorization process.

questions.text: A 19-year-old man is brought to the hospital by his cousin after being found naked and disoriented in a garden far away from where he lives. His cousin says this is not the first time the patient has gotten lost on his way home. The patient has also had diarrhea for several months. Physical exam is shown. This patient most likely has a deficiency of a substance that is derived from which of the following amino acids?

A male patient presented with complaints of imbalance, numbness of the foot, and muscle weakness. On history taking, he revealed that he has been taking multivitamin tablets more than the prescribed dose for 1 year. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the associated symptoms seen in this patient?

A 9-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of decreased vision, hearing, and speaking over the past 3 months. During this time, he has also had difficulty walking, concentrating, drawing, and feeding himself. His maternal male cousin had similar complaints and died at the age of 5 years. Neurologic examination shows an ataxic gait, spasticity, and decreased muscle strength in all extremities. Fundoscopy shows optic atrophy. Serum studies show elevated concentrations of fatty acids with 22 or more carbons. A deficiency in which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
Which of the following minerals help with Insulin Sensitivity?

A 24-year-old woman with a history of recurrent urinary tract infections comes to the physician with dysuria and increased urinary frequency. Her urine culture grows colonies of Gram-negative bacteria. The bacteria are isolated and placed in a growth-enhancing nutrient solution, where they undergo rapid cellular division. As they are actively dividing, the bacterial cells are lysed, and their DNA is extracted and purified. Analysis of the partially replicated DNA fragments shows the presence of uracil. This finding is most likely mediated by which of the following enzymes?

A 9-month-old male infant is brought to the physician because of a 2-month history of fatigue and weakness. The liver is palpated 1 cm below the right costal margin. Neurologic examination shows decreased muscle tone in the extremities. Serum glucose is 95 mg/dL. An x-ray of the chest shows cardiomegaly. The patient most likely has a deficiency of which of the following enzymes?
Which of the following is true regarding cyanide poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: Ingestion of peach seeds can cause this

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with achlorhydria are severely affected.

questions.correct_answer: A. Ingestion of peach seeds can cause this
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Ingestion of peach seeds can cause this

questions.text: A 24-month-old boy is brought to the physician for the evaluation of intellectual and behavioral abnormalities and abnormal movements of his extremities. His mother reports that he often hits his head and limbs against furniture. He is unable to walk without support and speaks in unclear 2-word phrases. Examination shows multiple bruises on the forehead and several healing wounds over the fingers. There is increased muscle tone in all extremities. Laboratory studies show an increased serum uric acid concentration. The serum concentration of which of the following substances is most likely to also be increased in this patient?
Which is correct about isoenzymes?

options.label: D
options.text: Cannot be separated from each other on Electrophoresis.

questions.text: A critically ill patient who is a registered organ donor collapses even after resuscitative measures. All of the following tests can be used to check the cessation of circulation, except:

A couple comes to the clinic for preconception counseling. They are offered genetic screening because they are of Ashkenazi Jewish descent. Test results show that both are carriers for a lysosomal enzyme deficiency disorder that results in decreased metabolic degradation of a phospholipid substrate to ceramide, which leads to a buildup of the phospholipid. The couple wants to know the clinical features of an affected child. Which of the following findings would be most consistent with this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Abnormally shaped bones and corneal clouding

options.label: B
options.text: Coarse facial features and cardiac dysfunction

questions.text: A 7-month-old boy is evaluated in the clinic due to delayed motor development. Further evaluation reveals mutation of a protein involved in the assembly of small nuclear ribonucleoproteins (snRNPs) in motor neurons. This patient most likely has impaired function of which of the following cellular elements?
Which is the most common intracranial lesion due to head injury?
15 kg of tension in the ligature around the neck is enough to occlude which of the following structures?

options.label: D
options.text: Jugular vein + Carotid artery + Trachea + Vertebral artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Jugular vein + Carotid artery + Trachea
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Jugular vein + Carotid artery + Trachea

questions.text: Regarding oxygenases, which of the following is not correct?

A 6-month-old boy is brought to the physician because of a seizure. Examination shows muscle hypotonia. His serum lactic acid and alanine are elevated. A functional assay of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex in serum leukocytes shows decreased enzyme activity. Supplementation with which of the following substances should be avoided in this patient?
